title.narrative: Increasing child survival rates from birth and in the first year of life in the Kara, Plateaux & Maritime regions of Togo.

description.narrative: The project will reduce the risk of death from pregnancy complications for 850 of the neediest pregnant women in the Kara, Plateaux and Maritime regions of Togo. Child survival rates will have increased and 567 of the infants born through this project will have reached their first birthday and entered early childhood with a strong foundation for development (other babies under one will continue to benefit from the survival interventions until age one). The primary beneficiaries are the neediest pregnant mothers and babies from the poorest households in three regions with high maternal and infant mortality rates. On average, a mother has five children who will be the secondary beneficiaries as well as other family members. Additionally, residents in communities located near the Child Development Centres will benefit from other complementary interventions delivered by Compassion, such as access to safe drinking water through solar-powered boreholes.
